intro: Zanthoxylum attiense, commonly known as the Mexican prickly ash, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its compound leaves and spiny twigs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by red, berry-like fruits. Zanthoxylum attiense is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
